content:
As an AI language model, I can suggest a few books and films that center on issues related to diverse expressions of sexuality. The list is not exhaustive, and there are many other works that address these issues as well:

Books:
- "The Origin of Others" by Toni Morrison
- "This Bridge Called My Back: Writings by Radical Women of Color" edited by Cherríe Moraga and Gloria Anzaldúa
- "Sister Outsider" by Audre Lorde
- "Gender Trouble: Feminism and the Subversion of Identity" by Judith Butler

Films:
- "Moonlight" directed by Barry Jenkins
- "The Handmaiden" directed by Park Chan-wook
- "Tangerine" directed by Sean Baker
- "Portrait of a Lady on Fire" directed by Céline Sciamma

These works explore issues of gender, sexuality, identity, and power in diverse and nuanced ways, and may be of interest to someone wanting to learn more about these topics.
